Bella Gordon P.S. 64 collection BCMS.0042
1.1 Linear Feet in 1 flat box.
1923 A small collection of materials relating to Brooklyn middle school P.S. 64 in East New York. These materials were compiled by Bella Gordon, a student in the class of 1923.
Biographical note
Bella Gordon was born in 1909 and attended P.S. 64 in East New York, Brooklyn, where she completed middle school in 1923.
Scope and Contents
The collection consists of two black and white photographs mounted on board, a leatherbound autograph book, and a postcard.
Conditions Governing Access
Open to researchers without restriction.
Conditions Governing Use
While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
Provenance
Donated by Nancy Kossar, daughter of Bella Gordon, in 2018.
Arrangement
The four items in this collection are stored in one box.
